title: What are some examples of intuition? - Quora

response.answer_text: What is the most intuitive act? The most intuitive act is scratching one’s balls. Mind you, they say a woman’s intuition operates on a whole other level! Well it would have to, probably. Wait. I’m thinking instinctual. Intuitive. Not the same thing. Okay, I change my answer. The most intuitive act is changing your answer. Well, your mind anyhow. The act of reconsideration. Nothing is more powerfully, primally intuitive. Second most intuitive act? Plumping for something. Good ol’ Merriam-Webster’s Dictionary has “plump” as verb: “To favor or decide in favor of someone or something strongly or emphatically—used with for.” It’s a powerful turn of mind, plumping. Call it a hunch, call it a gut call, but it’s guided and led by intuition’s siren call. It’s intuition’s plummeting raptor that screams from the skies in a death-dive and bomb-pounces up in an arc, with the whatever-it-was clutched in its cruel talons. That’s intuition. Well no, all that is more the act of acting on it. Intuition itself is just the feeling. You’re like (not out loud), “Hey….yeah.” From there, some drift thataway to circle in all cool, some pounce, some power-dive shrieking. Intuition’s not about what you do with it. It’s about the it you know what to do with. Suddenly, sometimes. Or dawning like day, welling up from beneath the horizon. Wow. Reason I say plumping is second-most intuitive is, it doesn’t take a rampaging golden monolith of intuition to come to the big inkling. When you haven’t anything decided in the matter, intuition can easily drift in and settle on whatever stirs it up. But the unsettling. The unplumping. The act of reconsideration. That takes a strong, keen lean of intuition, insistently growing to inexorable. Hoo! That’s a potent intuition. It’s not about scratching one’s balls. That’s just instinct. Some urge.
